Reviews.Content: An unknown gem This hotel is great.They have just finished refurbishing the whole hotel, so it's brand new!Rooms were comfortable and food, although a limited menu was very good.Location is great, too. It's only about 100 yards to the first class Gran Via Shopping Mall, with a great Supermarket, Restaurants, Movie Theater, and many boutique type shops. The Metro (Subway) runs until about midnight, buy a set of ten tickets at just over half price. There are many trains all going to and from Plaza Espana. Then you need to change trains at Plaza Espana, from where you can go anywhere in Barcelona. It's easy if you get a map!Pity they don't have a swimming pool, but then we were too busy in Barcelona to have any time to swim!
Reviews.Author: David-Sugar-Free

Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surpised We ended up at AC Som not from choice, but because the city centre hotel we had expected to be at had double-booked our room. When we were packed off to the AC Som instead (no pool, located in a retail park outside the city centre, major roadworks outside, depressing decor with black being the main colour in our room) I felt like getting on the next flight home. However, the reception staff were really kind and helpful and the room turned out to be comfortable (once we'd got used to the black!) with a very nice bathroom with a wonderful array of complimentary toiletries. We didn't have an evening meal at the hotel, but the buffet breakfast was superb, one of the best we've ever had.
Reviews.Author: Kikifrog

Reviews.Content: Great time in AC Som Just came back from a great week in barcelona and stayed in this hotel for 6 nights. As we travelled as two young couple, we were looking for something reasonably priced but good quality and AC SOM offered just that. Upon arrival we found the information we were offered at the reception very useful and they were always there to answer questions and more than willing to help us. Well in the beginning our airco didnt work but we were moved to a new room and didnt mind at all, our friends lights werent working and in the end we all got complimentary breakfast. For the one week we stayed the rooms were cleaned daily and the towels we changed. We were looking forward to going to the fitness room and sauna but unfortunately they were both so small we lost interest. The hotel is situated 3 - 5 minutes away from a shopping complex call Gran Via 2 which open until 11pm!! That was great and the mall is huge and there is everything in there. to get to the city centre (catalunya) wasnt a problem at all as there is a train to placa espanya (5 minute ride) and from there you can get the metro to the centre.It was hot but we always came back to cold refreshments for free!! If you are looking a good quite hotel and especially for young couples this is the place.
Reviews.Author: PAID

Reviews.Content: Thoroughly Dissapointing From the other reviews, I figured that this hotel would be kept to a high standard. I was wrong.First off, the location isn't great. In the middle of what can only be described as a retail park. As you walk in you immediately get the sense of expensive modern style - which is partly nice, it is also incredibly cold, and not very welcoming.The biggest problem we had was with bugs. Only a few minutes after walking into our first room, we found a cockroach running around on the floor. We immediately called reception and they sent someone up to inspect, they then offered us another room which we accepted - plus a free breakfast the next morning (although its not like you'd feel like eating after having a cockroach in your room).Thankfully our next room didnt include a cockroach, although we noticed a fair few other small bugs crawling in and out of the woodwork (small white worm type things). We didnt consider this a big deal - although for the price you pay and the standard offered, you certainly dont expect this type of thing. The second room also wasnt quite as good as our first one - the bathroom wasnt as modern, and didnt include a bidet (something which is very common in spanish hotels).The room itself was well designed, with modern furnishings and decor, but quite cold (whites, greys, dark wood). Unfortunately we noticed peeling paint in the bathroom and some peeling wooden laminate elsewhere. We also had a cracked toilet seat. All of which arent big problems, but something you dont expect at this kind of hotel.The room service was touted as being '24 hours', with a menu in our room clearly stating this. Unfortunately when we attempted to order room service, it wasnt 24 hours at all - as the hotel was undergoing some changes they told us that it wouldn't be 24 hours until next month. Dissapointing.The rooms do include a complimentary mini bar; although this includes four soft drinks, two bottles of still water and one sparkling water - so no alcoholic beverages here. But it is a nice touch nevertheless. The hotel also offers complimentary Gym access, the gym(s) are small but well equipped for the average visitor. Plasma TV, radio, tredmill, cycle, a myriad of weights, fresh towels, water, a shower and a sauna. Very useful indeed.Overall we were very dissapointed with the standard, although the staff were helpful to a certain extent.
Reviews.Author: DG55

Reviews.Content: Surprisingly Great This hotel was booked based solely on price and convenience to the airport. We were pleasantly surprised as this hotel was quite pleasant and relaxing. The only problem at the time was the temporarily closed accessible Metro stop. The front desk was helpful. And the dinner at the hotel restaurant was delicious for a very reasonable price.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Over my expectation Hi, I and my wife stayed in Capital Hotel in Barcelona from 2 to 6 August 2005. The hotel exceeded my expectations. Having opportunity to travel for business I had comparison to 45* hotels but to be honest the Capital is nicer than many of them. The hotel is in the new modern building. The rooms are not big but nice and enough to rest after the hot day in Barcelona. Clean. Towels changed everyday. Reasonably quiet (off the traffic).Location is not a big problem (even if during our stay undergand station was closed and we had to use shutlle bus to Pl. Espana - 10-15 min.)The hotel has a restaurant but the manu is not long and not much sophisticated. Nevertheless, nice service! BTW, they have also nice concept Self Room Service. You call, you bring, you eat in the room (all at reasonable price). But any way if you go to Barca for fun you will have plenty opportunities in the downtown.Recommended
Reviews.Author: Arni1972

Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but Metro is closed! PLEASE NOTE: The Metro is closed from July 16th to September 11th 2005 near this hotel. Just wanted to get that in the headline! This is a really great hotel, modern, light, friendly, spacious rooms, gorgeous design. It is obviously intended for business travellers rather than tourists (no pool or area to go out and get a tan!) but if you want a good base for your holiday, this is worth it. There is a massive shopping centre across the road from the hotel with a huge range of shops and restaurants and a large supermarket. The hotel is around 1 hour WALK into the city centre, so you cannot concievably say this is close - in fact the area, L麓hospitaliet, is technically a separate city from Barcelona! To get into the city you would normally get the Metro, but unfortunately we found the Metro was closed from the day we arrived until mid-September which means you have to get buses into the city all the time, which although not TOO much of a hassle, is nowhere near as convenient as getting the Metro! A recommended hotel though.
Reviews.Author: BristolMan

Reviews.Content: Chic, modern, friendly hotel Cannot say enough about this hotel! The decor is modern, clean, gorgeous. The rooms are extremely clean, well appointed, COMFORTABLE! Best bathroom in all our hotel stays (in spain and france). All staff was helpful and friendly. They accomodated our every wish. Free internet use in the lobby. Great little restaurant. Downtown, or the center of town is a train/taxi ride away, which for some people may be inconvenient, but it worked for us and it definitely was easy to get to town via the subway - which is a short 3 minute walk from the hotel. There is a huge shopping center across the street from the hotel, as well as an IKEA. We will definitely return to this hotel!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Good location great price!       Foyer 1
Reviews.Author: MiB

Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable, but some traffic noise We stayed in the Hotel Capital (also known as the HR Capital Hotel) for four nights in January 2004. Listed as a 4-star hotel on some accommodation websites, the hotel is officially rated 3-star and located in the Hospitalet de Llobregat area, just outside the centre of Barcelona. The nearest metro station (Ildefons Cerd脿) is a mere 2-minute stroll away, however, so Barcelona's excellent public transport system means you're only minutes from the city centre. Just 2 stops along the pink L8 drops you at Pla莽a d鈥橢spanya, while a quick switch from there to the red L1 will drop you bang in the middle of things at Pla莽a Catalunya four stops later.The road onto which the hotel faces is quite busy, so street noise (as with most hotels in Barcelona) can be a problem. Several websites list the hotel as having soundproofed rooms, but this was not the case with our room so if you think that this may be a problem you may wish to check your room allocation before booking.The hotel itself is clean, modern, and tastefully decorated. Our room (812) was spotlessly clean and pleasantly spacious, and the blackout blinds and air conditioning were certainly a plus. Showering may pose a problem for less mobile guests, however: our bath was surrounded by quite deep stone tiling and the fixed glass shower door restricted the access space somewhat, which meant that you needed to be fairly agile to climb into it. Guests with mobility problems should request more accessible bathroom facilities.The hotel has a restaurant, but we did not eat there and so cannot comment on the quality of the food or service. We did notice, however, that the menu did not change from day to day.When booking, you may wish to reserve accommodation only, as we did. While the hotel serves breakfast, there is a large shopping centre (Gran Via 2) situated almost opposite the hotel where you can find a number of coffee shops and cheap and cheerful restaurants where you can purchase your coffee and croissant for a fraction of the price. The shopping centre, which stays open until 10pm, also has a large Carrefour supermarket and a large selection of shops in which to while away a few hours, while the restaurants and cineplex stay open until later still.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, clean room. Sept. 2004Have just come back from a four night stay in the Capital Hotel.Although situated slightly out of the tourist area there is a Metro just a 2 minute walk away. Placa Espana is just 2 stops on the Metro.Hotel room was fine, clean, tidy,and bed comfortableThere is a large shopping complex,including manyrestaurants, just across the road.Staff were friendly and am currently looking at booking again for next year.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Cheap designer hotel we stayed here in august this year, 5 nights cost 拢220 for the room(拢22 each night each person). modern designer hotel, reception very helpful, clean rooms, faboulous views(we were on the 9th floor), air-conditioning a big plus. cross the road and you are in a giant(and cheap) shopping mall, behind this mall is a train station with trains running every 10 minutes to the centre of Barcelona. this hotel is located just on the other side of the montjuic mountains
